alert.note: Alert for Benton; Iowa; Johnson; Linn (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 05 at 7:46PM CST until March 05 at 8:00PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CST FOR NORTHWESTERN JOHNSON...SOUTHERN BENTON...LINN AND NORTHERN IOWA COUNTIES... At 746 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Troy Mills to near Shellsburg to near Marengo, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Shellsburg around 750 PM CST. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Central City, Palo, Paris, Conroy, Coggon, Toddville, Hiawatha, Robins, Prairieburg, Alburnett, Norway, Amana, Cedar Rapids, Marion, Fairfax, Walford, Whittier and Waubeek. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CST for northeastern and east central Iowa. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building.
